job.name: MNIST_Model_Training_And_Deployment

variable.name: CONTAINER_PLATFORM
variable.description: The container platform to be used for executing the workflow tasks.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: The service instance name.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_PROXYFIED
variable.description: A YAML file that describes the OpenAPI Specification ver. 2 (known as Swagger Spec) of the service. This file should be stored in the catalog under the model_as_service bucket.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_ENTRYPOINT
variable.description: This entry script starts the service and defines the different functions to deploy the model, scores the prediction requests based on the deployed model, and returns the results.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_YAML_FILE
variable.description: A YAML file that describes the OpenAPI Specification ver. 2 (known as Swagger Spec) of the service. This file should be stored in the catalog under the model_as_service bucket.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_USER_NAME
variable.description: A valid username having the needed privileges to execute this action.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_NODE_NAME
variable.description: The name of the node where the service will be deployed. If empty, the service will be deployed on an available node selected randomly.

variable.name: CONTAINER_GPU_ENABLED
variable.description: If True, the service will be configured to use the GPU.

variable.name: CONTAINER_IMAGE
variable.description: Name of the container image being used to run the workflow tasks.

job.description: Train a MNIST model using Keras and deploy it using the MaaS_DL service.

script.code:
__file__ = variables.get("PA_TASK_NAME") print("BEGIN " + __file__)
################################################################### import tensorflow as tf from tensorflow import keras
# Helper libraries import numpy as np import os import subprocess import uuid from shutil import make_archive
# Dataset Loading fashion_mnist = keras.datasets.fashion_mnist (train_images, train_labels), (test_images, test_labels) = fashion_mnist.load_data()
# scale the values to 0.0 to 1.0 train_images = train_images / 255.0 test_images = test_images / 255.0
# reshape for feeding into the model train_images = train_images.reshape(train_images.shape[0], 28, 28, 1) test_images = test_images.reshape(test_images.shape[0], 28, 28, 1)
class_names = ['T-shirt/top', 'Trouser', 'Pullover', 'Dress', 'Coat', 'Sandal', 'Shirt', 'Sneaker', 'Bag', 'Ankle boot']
print('\ntrain_images.shape: {}, of {}'.format(train_images.shape, train_images.dtype))
# Model definition and training model = keras.Sequential([ keras.layers.Conv2D(input_shape=(28,28,1), filters=8, kernel_size=3, strides=2, activation='relu', name='Conv1'), keras.layers.Flatten(), keras.layers.Dense(10, activation=tf.nn.softmax, name='Softmax') ]) model.summary()
testing = False epochs = 5
model.compile(optimizer='adam', loss='sparse_categorical_crossentropy', metrics=['accuracy']) model.fit(train_images, train_labels, epochs=epochs)
test_loss, test_acc = model.evaluate(test_images, test_labels) print('\nTest accuracy: {}'.format(test_acc))
# Fetch the Keras session and save the model # The signature definition is defined by the input and output tensors, # and stored with the default serving key
# Get an unique ID id = str(uuid.uuid4()) zip_file_name = "mnist_model_"+str(id) zip_file = "mnist_model_"+str(id)+".zip"
# Create an empty dir export_path = os.path.join('models', id) os.makedirs(export_path, exist_ok=True) print("export_path: " + export_path)
tf.keras.models.save_model( model, export_path, overwrite=True, include_optimizer=True, save_format=None, signatures=None, options=None ) ###################################################################
make_archive(os.path.join(export_path,zip_file_name), 'zip', root_dir=export_path) print("list of files :", os.listdir(export_path)) print("list of files underl models:", os.listdir("models"))
variables.put("zip_file_path", os.path.join(export_path,zip_file))
print("END " + __file__)

task.name: MaaS_DL_Actions
task.description: Manage the life-cycle of MaaS_DL. This workflow trigger three possible actions: Pause_MaaS_DL, Resume_MaaS_DL and Finish_MaaS_DL.

variable.name: ACTION
variable.description: The action that will be processed regarding the service status.

variable.name: INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: Service instance name.

variable.name: INSTANCE_ID
variable.description: The service instance ID

task.name: Wait_for_Terminate_Job_and_Service
task.description: A template task that sends a ready notification for all the signals specified in the variable SIGNALS, then loops until one signal among those specified is received by the job.

variable.name: SIGNALS
variable.description: The list of comma-separated signals expected by this task.

task.name: Wait_for_Validation
task.description: A template task that sends a ready notification for all the signals specified in the variable SIGNALS, then loops until one signal among those specified is received by the job.

variable.name: SIGNALS
variable.description: The list of comma-separated signals expected by this task.

script.code:
println("BEGIN " + variables.get("PA_TASK_NAME"))
condition = results[0].value() println("condition: " + condition) variables.put("CONDITION", condition)
println("END " + variables.get("PA_TASK_NAME"))

task.name: MaaS_DL_Service_Start
task.description: Start a model server to deploy DL models.

variable.name: SERVICE_ID
variable.description: The name of the service. Please keep the default value for this variable.

variable.name: INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: The name of the service that will be deployed.

variable.name: ENGINE
variable.description: The container platform that will be used (no container, docker, singularity, or podman).

variable.name: PROXYFIED
variable.description: True if a proxy is needed to protect the access to this model-service endpoint. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_PROXYFIED workflow variable.

variable.name: PYTHON_ENTRYPOINT
variable.description: This entry script starts the service and defines the different functions to deploy the model, scores the prediction requests based on the deployed model, and returns the results. This script is specific to your model. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_ENTRYPOINT workflow variable.

variable.name: YAML_FILE
variable.description: A YAML file that describes the OpenAPI Specification ver. 2 (known as Swagger Spec) of the service. This file should be stored in the catalog under the model_as_service bucket. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_ENTRYPOINT workflow variable.

variable.name: USER_NAME
variable.description: A valid username having the needed privileges to execute this action. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_USER_NAME workflow variable.

variable.name: NODE_NAME
variable.description: The name of the node where the service will be deployed. If empty, the service will be deployed on an available node selected randomly. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_NODE_NAME workflow variable.

variable.name: MaaS_DL_INSTANCE_ENDPOINT
variable.description: The endpoint of the started service.

variable.name: DEPLOY_ENDPOINT
variable.description: The base path to access the deployment endpoint.

variable.name: SERVICE_TOKEN
variable.description: A valid token generated by the MaaS_ML Service for user authentication.

variable.name: APPEND
variable.description: If True, the model will be appended to the list of already deployed models.

variable.name: MODEL_NAME
variable.description: The name of the model to be deployed.

variable.name: MODEL_URL
variable.description: A valid URL specified by the user referencing the model that needs to be deployed.

variable.name: MODEL_VERSION
variable.description: The version number of the model that will be deployed.
